result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwon D Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 02-27-16 at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 04-01-15. Non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
COURT ALLOWS FOR EXPUNGEMENT AFTER 1 YEAR, IF ALL COSTS HAVE BEEN PAID.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwon D Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter response to defendant's request for extension or payment plan.
REQUEST FOR EXTENSION FOR PAYMENT PLAN.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Antwon D Moore in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defendant and Defense.  Court ordered defendant serve 3 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.  Court ordered defendant pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 2/27/16 at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 4-1-15.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  Court allows for expungment after 1 year if all costs have been paid.  Attorney Dunn informed the Court that he WAIVES his fees for this hearing and conducted this hearing pro-bono.

Defendant Antwon D Moore in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant requests additional time to obtain counsel.  Court briefly questions defendant as to his financials.  Court finds defendant qualifies for representation at county expense.  Attorney Dunn accepts appointment.  Matter passed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antwon D Moore in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Antwon D Moore in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to RESERVED BRANCH 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
